issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
For stacks, deletion is a long running process. The UI returns the following when you issue the delete command:
Successfully deleted stack. $name

It should say something like:
We have kicked off deletion of stack: $name
fields.summary: Delete stack message shouldn’t say "Successfully deleted stack. web” because it hasnt completed

comments.body:
[~dkavanagh], here is the message you asked me to draft:

_Successfully sent delete stack request. It may take a few minutes to delete stack <stack name>._

[~dkavanagh], the fix worked on Firefox and Safari but not Chrome. Weird.

Will you please take a look?

And I'm noticing that our messages state that some actions (like launch instance, delete instance, create stack) will "take a moment" when they take longer than that. Now, we can debate how long a "moment" is but one request took a couple of minutes.

Any idea why we are using "may take a moment" when "may take a few minutes" might be more accurate?

The message is generated on the server, so it has to be the same on all browsers. Are you sure you hit the same console?

I would address some of this messaging w/ Jenny since she chose all of the text.

Huh? No, no. The console is the same. The browsers are the same.

It is the messages I'm asking about.

I asked you to use "may take a few minutes" but the other messages say "may take a moment."

Since [~jloza] is unavailable, to be consistent with the other messages she wrote, could you please change my message to match hers, [~dkavanagh]?

So, please change:

_Successfully sent delete stack request. It may take a few minutes to delete stack <stack name>._

to 

_Successfully sent delete stack request. It may take a moment to delete stack <stack name>.
_

You got the "Delete stack" error message when deleting from the stack landing page. Looks like you missed the "Delete stack" error message from the newly created stack (the stack details page).

Could you please extend your work to the other delete stack?

[~dkavanagh], oddly, on Firefox the delete stack notification is slightly cut off (see attachment).

Could you maybe wrap the line after "may" or move the "X" a bit to the right so "take" is not cut off?
[~lnajjar], this is a problem with the notification system, not with this fix.

Verified on Macintosh running Chrome Version 45.0.2454.101 (64-bit), Firefox 41.0, and Safari 8.0.8.

UX review passed. Ready for code review.

[~dkavanagh], [~lnajjar], is there a display issue with text wrap in the notification system (comments above indicate there was an issue outside the scope of this bug fix)? If so, can one of you please write a bug for that and include a screenshot showing the problem?

CC: [~ashamblin]

Tested on Shared Setup #1

Deleted stack, confirmed updated success message.
